name: Temple
blurb: Locus of divine kingship and human silence; judgment discourse ends in doxological hush.

name: Priests
blurb: Priestly establishment implicated in syncretism and compromise.

name: Jerusalem
blurb: City of corruption and eventual renewal; site of leadership failure and divine rejoicing.

name: Day of the LORD
blurb: Near and comprehensive judgment that purifies a people for universal worship.

name: Ashkelon
blurb: Destined for desolation and later sheepfolds for the remnant.

name: Day of the LORD (canonical trajectory)
blurb: From Amos’s warning to Joel’s apocalyptic textures to Zephaniah’s purification and Malachi’s eschaton—the Day as judgment-unto-renewal.

name: Ashdod
blurb: Philistine city struck at noon—symbol of suddenness.

name: Ekron
blurb: Uprooted in the Day; completes the four-city Philistine list.

name: Gaza
blurb: Philistine city facing abandonment in the Day.

name: Humble/Meek
blurb: Those who seek the LORD and practice righteousness; core of the renewed community.

name: Josiah king of Judah (context)
blurb: Reform-era monarch providing historical frame. Zephaniah’s indictments may precede or accompany Josiah’s centralizing reforms.

name: Remnant theology & humility
blurb: Seek humility; the remnant is characterized by meekness and justice.

name: Superscription
blurb: Names the prophet, genealogy, and Josian context—signals authority and possible royal descent.

name: King of Israel, the LORD in your midst
blurb: Title highlighting immanent kingship: God present as warrior-savior who quiets with love and exults over Zion in song.

name: Nineveh
blurb: Boasting city reduced to ruins; animals lodge in her thresholds.

name: Peoples with purified lips
blurb: Nations transformed to call upon the LORD with one accord—Babel reversed.

name: Proud/Arrogant
blurb: The haughty removed from Zion; pride is antithetical to remnant identity.

name: Remnant (humble and lowly)
blurb: A purified community characterized by humility and honesty; they find refuge in the LORD.

name: Gate/Watch personnel

name: Householders on rooftops

name: Judges
blurb: Predatory officials—wolves at evening who leave nothing for the morning.

name: Officials

name: Prophets (Jerusalem)
blurb: Reckless and treacherous; Zephaniah indicts prophetic malpractice alongside priests.

name: Zephaniah son of Cushi
blurb: Prophet whose name likely means “YHWH has hidden/protected,” resonating with 2:3’s hope of being hidden in the Day. Ministers in the days of Josiah with a message of judgment-purification-restoration.
